text: have you ever had key lime pie it's
actually really really easy to make

exactly a pie it's a tart today I'm
actually using regular limes instead of
key limes they're a little bit more
accessible but if you can get your hands
on some key limes I highly recommend
using them to start off with though you
need to make your graham cracker crust 9
to 10 graham crackers line them up in
your food processor and listening to see
if it sounds like they're all ground up
okay that's good to that add 4
tablespoons of melted unsalted butter
and 2 tablespoons of sugar have your
oven preheating right now at the 350
degrees because you're gonna bake this
before you add your filling process it
until everything is moistened by the
butter this is an instance where you
don't have to worry about over
processing it you actually want
everything to come together and be a
little bit sticky and then press it into
a 9-inch pan this is a tart pan with a
removable bottom the lime filling is so
intense and delicious you really don't
need that much so all your crumb mixture
goes into your pan a nice even layer and
then I take the bottom of a measuring
cup and press it in really tamp it down
and make it really nice and firm into
the sides as well and as you can see I
have my tart pan on a rimmed baking
sheet for ease of moving it around once
your crust is evenly pressed in put this
directly into a 350 degree oven and bake
it until it just sort of gets a little
bit fragrant and turns slightly darker
golden brown about 10 minutes cooked
crust for the filling you'll need 3/4 of
a cup of fresh lime juice I don't care
if you use Key Lime or regular lime just
don't use the bottled stuff it won't
taste as good I have a half a cup of
sugar in this bowl to that add 14 ounces
of sweetened condensed milk add your
lime juice whisk together
and then you want to add four egg yolks
I'm going to separate your eggs just
want the egg yolks so be careful want to
save your egg whites maybe you want to
put meringue on top of your pie so you
want to make sure you don't get any yolk
inside of your whites whisk your egg
yolks in once everything is nice and
smooth a pinch of salt it heightens the
flavor of all dishes that's why I put it
into everything that I cook if you bang
on the bowl a little bit it releases
some of the air bubbles pour the filling
into the crust carefully then put it
back into the oven until it's set 20 to
25 minutes when it comes out of the oven
you want to make sure to let it cool
completely and then put it into the
refrigerator for at least two hours to
completely set
but isn't that beautiful if you want to
